model
Class RESTful

java.lang.Object
  model.RESTful
Direct Known Subclasses:
RESTfulSearch, RESTfulWget
public abstract class RESTful
extends java.lang.Object

The RESTful class is a abstract class that represents the structure of ESGF RESTful API.

Allows access to data in ESGF by URL in ESGF index node and return results matching the given constraints. Because of the distributed capabilities of the ESGF search, the URL at any Index Node can be used to query that Node only, or all Nodes in the ESGF system.

RESTful API that is used to query the ESGF search services can also be used, with minor modifications, to generate a wget script to download all files matching the given constraints. This functionality is extended and implemented in RESTfulSearch and RESTfulWget.

The general syntax of the ESGF RESTful service URL is:

  • Search service: http://baseURL/search?[keyword parameters as (name, value) pairs][facet parameters as (name,value) pairs]
  • Wget service: http://baseURL/wget?[keyword parameters as (name, value) pairs][facet parameters as (name,value) pairs]

or more explicity:

  • http://base search url/?[query=...][offset=...][limit=...][type=...][format= ...][facets=...][fields =...][lat,lon,radius,polygon,location=...][start,end=... ][from,to=...][facet1=value1][facet2=value2][...]

    • Use generateServiceURL() method for generate url of RESTful service.

    Author:
    Karem Terry

    Method Detail

    getBaseServiceURL

    public java.net.URL getBaseServiceURL()
    Get base URL.

    Returns:
    baseServiceURL is an url of an ESGF node. The RESTful service request will be processed in that node.

    setBaseServiceURL

    public void setBaseServiceURL(java.net.URL baseServiceURL)
    Set base URL.

    Parameters:
    baseServiceURL - url of ESGF node where the RESTful service request will be processed
    Throws:
    java.net.MalformedURLException

    public Keywords getServiceKeywords()

    Returns:

    addFacetParameter

    public void addFacetParameter(Facet facet)
    Add a facet in RESTful service configuration, if facet already is configured changes its value.

    Parameters:
    facet - to be added in RESTful service configuration

    removeFacetParameter

    public Facet removeFacetParameter(java.lang.String facetName)
    Remove a Facet of RESTful service configuration

    Parameters:
    facetName - Facet to be removed
    Returns:
    removed facet if exists and null otherwise

    containsFacetParameter

    public boolean containsFacetParameter(java.lang.String facetName)
    Return true if contains a Facet with facetName in ESGF RESTful configuration or false otherwise.

    Parameters:
    facetName - name of facet
    Returns:
    true if contains a facet with facetName or false otherwise

    generateServiceURL

    public abstract java.net.URL generateServiceURL()
    Constructs url of service RESTful. The general syntax of the ESGF service URL is: http:///[search? or wget?][keyword parameters as (name, value) pairs][facet parameters as (name,value) pairs]

    Returns:
    URL
